byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Negotiators remain divided over nuclear deal with Iran one day before deadline, with all sides acknowledging that talks will require extension; key issues like monitoring system and question of nuclear 'breakout' constraints remain as divisive as they were 18 months earlier when negotiations began; most contentious of issues at play highlighted.
lead_paragraph: Officials said questions about inspections and how fast Iran could expand its nuclear infrastructure in the waning years of a deal are still vexing, just as they were at the start of negotiations.

headline.main: Crucial Questions Remain as Iran Nuclear Talks Approach Deadline
headline.print_headline: Sticking Points as Iran Nuclear Talks Near Deadline

snippet: Officials said questions about inspections and how fast Iran could expand its nuclear infrastructure in the waning years of a deal are still vexing, just as they were at the start of negotiations.
